title: 820-00165 KPs on internal SSD
message:
Thai machine came in with a dead SSD, backlight no image.
Replaced SSD and boot fine but when logged in it random restarts with kernel panic.

Run from external drive the machine works fine.

Tried installing a fresh OS but installation hung. Restarted in verbos and it reported KP.

No corrosion. No visibles.

Will upload KP log once I have a fresh install on there..

title: 820-00165 KPs on internal SSD
message:
We have two 00165 boards with exact same issue (kernels on-boot when booting to internal SSD). Board works fine with SSD installed, as long as you don't boot to it. Booting to USB and diagnostics works fine, every time.

Was this one resolved, by chance?

title: 820-00165 KPs on internal SSD
message:
have you guys tried erasing the flashdrives in an external housing>putting them back and reinstalling OS (preferably elcapitan, since the new AFPS sucks balls) ? I have had funky issues like the ones described, after wiping externally and doing a reinstall (with drive in machine) everything was back to normal. 

the new apfs stuff is literally driving me nuts, the volumes are not recognised on most machines that run an earlier filesystem.

title: 820-00165 KPs on internal SSD
message: This is 100% not an SSD issue, guaranteed. I've tried 6+ with each board, and it's very consistent. Issue happens when booting to SSD, but not if SSD is simply installed (and you boot to external or internet recovery, or ASD, etc). This is a board issue, and I settled on it being a CPU issue, or maybe an issue in the board. Was curious if anyone had determined otherwise. I can post the kernel panic I get, but it's likely not going to be much help unfortunately. I might throw a new BIOS on one to see if that helps, as maybe it was damaged during update to HS. I doubt it, but it's the only other thing I can think of.

title: 820-00165 KPs on internal SSD
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30970"]Tried another known good SSD?[/QUOTE]

Yes tried that first. Inspected relevant areas of the board.
I gave it back, not worth the time.
